result.execSummary:
The defendant Felipe Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 bond applied leaving balance due of $193.00

30 days in Marquette County Jail consecutive to any sentence he may now be serving. Huber granted. May serve in Waushara County. Sentence to commence on or before 3/18/16 by 7:00 p.m. clean & sober. Sentence may be served on electronic monitoring if available.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felipe Rodriguez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Felipe Rodriguez in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct 1 to Possession of THC, as a 1st offense, Party to the Crime (No repeater allegation).  Joint recommendation for jail and costs.  Atty Frank agrees.  BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the amendment as stated.  
Defendant enters a No Contest plea to the amended Ct 1.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  Court questions Atty Frank.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the Amended Ct 1.
Atty Frank makes sentencing statement.
BY THE COURT:  *Court sentences defendant to serve 30 days in the Marquette County Jail, consecutive to any sentence he may now be serving.  *Huber granted.  *Granted 3 days credit.  *May be served in Waushara County.  *Sentence to commence on or before 3-18-16 by 7:00pm, clean and sober.  *Sentence may be served on electronic monitor if available.  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.  *Cash bond to be applied and balance to be paid within 60 days.

Defendant Felipe Rodriguez in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Frank requests plea be set 30-45 days out. No objection by Atty Hendee.
BY THE COURT:  Set for plea.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Felipe Rodriguez in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there have been offers to the defendant.  Atty Frank states that there is not an agreement at this time; however, the parties are close to resolution.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Petition for Leave To File Additional Motions

Defendant Felipe Rodriguez in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court questions the defendant regarding the English language.  Defendant understands English.   Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
Court finds probable cause.
Court questions the defendant regarding time limits.  Defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
